title: The Fall of Jerusalem and the Exile
summary: After Josiah’s death, his sons rule briefly. The people turn from God, and prophets are ignored. Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon destroys Jerusalem, burns the temple, and exiles the people. The book ends with King Cyrus of Persia allowing Jews to return and rebuild.

faq.question: Why did God allow Jerusalem to fall?
faq.answer: Because of Judah’s continued sin and rejection of the prophets.

faq.question: What hope is given at the end?
faq.answer: Cyrus, king of Persia, allows the Jews to return and rebuild the temple.
